# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/165785

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

pull_request.title: add cookapk.com tracking parameters
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/165785

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [ ] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
HAR file sent. Full steps to reproduce:

1. Download clean build of latest Firefox stable or Firefox nightly.
2. Install uBlock Origin.
3. Enable all AdGuard filters.
3a. Disable all other filters (not required to reproduce).
4. Set `privacy.globalprivacycontrol.enabled` and `privacy.globalprivacycontrol.functionality.enabled` to `true` in `about:config`.
4. Navigate to engadget.com, yahoo.com, or techcrunch.com.

The same modal appears on yahoo.com and techcrunch.com, and is fixed by the same filter rule for those domains:

```
www.yahoo.com###consent-gpc-popUp
techcrunch.com###consent-gpc-popUp
```

comment.body:
I was also having the same issue (i.e., the `slow down` error in browser while AdGuard was enabled).

I was checked my network traffic and the AdGuard debug log, and I think I've found at least two of the problematic rules. In the attached screenshot, I disabled the problematic rules temporarily as a test, and verified that disabling just those two rules fixed the issue.

They are part of the "AdGuard Base Filter" list, version `2.3.8.57`.

```
@@||challenges.cloudflare.com^$stealth
@@||chat.openai.com^$stealth
```

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/33649649/160cdd95-b595-4499-bd77-6658437789d6)

Hopefully this helps to identify the fix.

comment.body:
> I was also having the same issue (i.e., the `slow down` error in browser while AdGuard was enabled).
> 
> I checked my network traffic and the AdGuard debug log, and I think I've found at least two of the problematic rules. In the attached screenshot, I disabled the suspected problematic rules temporarily as a test, and verified that disabling just those two rules fixed the issue.
> 
> They are part of the "AdGuard Base Filter" list, version `2.3.8.57`.
> 
> ```
> @@||challenges.cloudflare.com^$stealth
> @@||chat.openai.com^$stealth
> ```
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33649649/281628331-160cdd95-b595-4499-bd77-6658437789d6.png)
> 
> Hopefully this helps to identify the fix.

Thanks. Just like I said, even if I clear the cookies, and disable all filters including the two rules you mentioned, DNS protection, and advanced tracking protection, it still "slows down". I can only access ChatGPT normally by completely disabling AdGuard. This only happens on Edge, if I have AdGuard enabled, I can open ChatGPT normally using Safari.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/165691#issuecomment-1803249353 - It cannot be fixed on DNS level, because it would require to unblock `pagead2.googlesyndication.com` globally, and it is used on many websites to load ads.
You can install AdGuard extension or app, it should fixes this anti-adblock notice even with DNS enabled.

comment.body: @QuantumRoseinAmethystVase Interesting. Thanks for the info, I didn't see the comment section where you provided those details. Probably a coincidence or a timing effect in my case that it fixed after disabling those filters. I noticed some `quic://` URLs being blocked in the filter log on my end. Did you by chance test temporarily whitelisting quic URLs (while leaving AdGuard enabled)? I've not tried that yet but am curious if it makes any difference.

pull_request.title: add cookapk.com tracking parameters
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/165785

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
>  how do you know the upgrade will make it go if you can't reproduce it?

Actually, i don't know exactly how upgrading can affect.
But, there are major changes in macOS and AdGuard for Mac.

If your Mac device can use Apple Boot Camp and uses a intel processor, can you test with Windows environment?
Also, a security vulnerability in outdated software can execute a malicious code.

comment.body: > Cannot reproduce with the same settings. Maybe you are using some tools that spam by requests to chat.openai.com? Maybe not. I installed a brand new Edge and Google Chrome, without changing any settings or installing any extensions, but the same error occurred. However, AdGuard works fine with my Safari. The problem seems to be related to the interaction between AdGuard and Chromium-based browsers. I have explored for a long time and found the problem. Here is the solution: 1. Add openai.com to the "regular" whitelist. 2. Change the UserAgent of Edge to Safari. These two steps are indispensable. Now I can access ChatGPT!

comment.body:
Проверил несколько эпизодов из сериала по ссылке выше - воспроизводятся корректно.
Попробуйте сделать следующее:
1. Обновить программу до `2.12.2`
2. Оставить только фильтры Адгард из конфигурации выше
3. Обновить их
4. Проверить обновления Chrome. Если предложит обновиться, выполните это
5. После этого в браузере очистите его данные
6. Перезапустите его
7. Откройте сайт.

comment.body:
> Ad leftovers can't be blocked in Google app. Use a browser instead.

But some websites don't show any leftover ads and some are showing. I could only request you that where there is Google app, then there should be support from adguard. Thanks for taking out to listen my problem and I hope that adguard will work in Google app ads problem too.
